div.p: Third child--first surviving child--of Johann and Julia Schenker, hence Heinrich Schenker's elder brother, who became a medical doctor. His wife's first name was Dodi, and they had a number of children, perhaps the oldest being Anton [Tonschl]. The couple lived in Kautzen, where they cared for Julia Schenker for the last three years of her life (1914â€“17).

Wilhelm does not appear to be mentioned in Schenker's diary before 1914, when Heinrich comments that Wilhelm is due to take his pension in 1915. Wilhelm--like Moriz, the youngest child--was relatively well-off, and he figures in Schenker's diary as providing money to Julia (OJ 1/15, pp. 677, 679, September 1 and 3, 1914), and in 1918 is involved with funeral and grave-stone arrangements for Julia.

div.head: Correspondence with Heinrich and Jeanette
div.p: Eight letters from Wilhelm to Heinrich and his wife Jeanette are known to survive as OJ 14/6 (1930-39) and two as OC 44/38 and A/296 (1934), and 106 letters and postcards from Heinrich to Wilhelm as OJ 5/38. Wilhelm maintained contact with Jeanette after Heinrich's death, his last surviving letter to her being dated June 1, 1939 (OJ 14/6, [8]).
